meanings.sent1: She stereographed a picture to make it look 3D.
meanings.sent2: The artist stereographed the landscape to create depth.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally stereographed his own finger in the photo.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a stereographed image, coming to life in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was as mesmerizing as a stereographed illusion.

meanings.definition: To create a three-dimensional image using two photographs taken from slightly different angles.
meanings.sent1: They stereographed the scene to make it pop out.
meanings.sent2: The museum exhibit was stereographed for a lifelike effect.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be stereographed in the photo, almost jumping out.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like stereographed images, vivid and real.
meanings.sent5: The movie used special effects to create a stereographed world.
